# dragInteraction(_:sessionAllowsMoveOperation:)

**Instance Method**

Asks the delegate whether the session allows the move operation.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor optional func dragInteraction(_ interaction: UIDragInteraction, sessionAllowsMoveOperation session: any UIDragSession) -> Bool
```

## Parameters

- **interaction**: The interaction that called this method.
- **session**: The drag session that should, or should not, allow the move operation.

## Return Value

[doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] if the session allows moving drag items to the destination view; otherwise [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false]. The default is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] if you don’t provide this method.

## Discussion

The [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDropOperation/move] operation only applies to drop activities within the same app. Drag items dropped onto another app are always copied.

## Restricting the drag behavior

- **dragInteraction(_:sessionIsRestrictedToDraggingApplication:)**: Asks the delegate whether the system should restrict the drag session to the app that started the session.
